short-title.#text:
Public Access to Historical Records
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Official dataset on
			 historical temperature record

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall establish an official dataset on the
			 historical temperature record.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the National
			 Aeronautics and Space Administration

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Establishment
			 of official dataset by NASA

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall use the raw data relating to temperature collected by each
			 applicable station and vessel and shall, for that purpose, reexamine applicable
			 records collected by such stations and vessels and accurately quantify the
			 statistical uncertainty (including estimates of random and bias errors) of each
			 temperature observation and any subsequent products based on such
			 observation.

text.#text: In establishing the dataset required by this section, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall clearly and fully identify each gap that exists in
			 temperature station data and temperature reading data.

text.#text: In establishing the dataset, the

header.#text:
Clear and full
			 identification of gaps in data

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
supplies or
			 fills in data to address a gap in temperature station data or temperature
			 reading data, or for any other reason, the
shall—

text.#text: If in establishing the dataset the

clearly and fully
			 identify the data so supplied or filled in as fill-in data; and

clearly and fully
			 explain the rationale for supplying or filling in such data.

header.#text:
Panel on use of
			 data for establishment of dataset

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall establish a panel to assist the

in the establishment of the dataset required by this
			 section.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
from
			 among individuals in the private sector with acknowledged expertise in
			 meteorology and statistics who—

text.#text:
The
			 panel shall consist of seven individuals appointed by the

do not have a
			 significant financial interest in taking a position on the matter of global
			 climate change; and

have not received
			 funding from any department, agency, or entity of the Federal Government for
			 activities relating to global climate research within the past five
			 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
in establishing the dataset required by
			 this section by—

text.#text:
The
			 panel shall assist the

establishing
			 standards and criteria for determining confidence levels for the interpolation
			 and extrapolation of historical average global temperatures over successive
			 25-year periods in the past; and

establishing a
			 rationale for an average historical global temperature and a means of analysis
			 for assessing the accuracy of such average.

header.#text:
Independent
			 verification and validation of dataset

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall enter into a contract with an appropriate entity that is
			 independent of the Federal Government to perform a verification and validation
			 of the dataset established under this section.

text.#text: Not less often than once every three years, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
enters into a
			 contract under this subsection shall be an entity with personnel having the
			 skills and expertise appropriate for the verification or validation (as the
			 case may be) of the dataset, including the following:

text.#text: An entity with which the

For the
			 verification, personnel with skills and expertise relating to computer
			 programming and computer software development (including error
			 handling).

For the
			 validation, personnel with expertise in statistics and meteorology.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall specify in the contract, including a
			 review of any data interpolation codes for purposes of identifying and
			 eliminating bias.

text.#text:
In
			 carrying out the verification or validation of the dataset under a contract
			 under this subsection, an entity shall carry out such activities with respect
			 to the dataset as the

Any
			 algorithms used, and any determinations made, in the verification and
			 validation of the dataset pursuant to this subsection shall be made available
			 to the public.

header.#text:
Use of dataset
			 in global climate research

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, any person or entity engaged in global climate
			 research that is funded in whole or in part with funds from the Federal
			 Government shall use the dataset as the source of data on the historical
			 temperature record.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:2

text.#text:
Upon the
			 completion of the establishment of the dataset on the historical temperature
			 record required by

header.#text:
Use as sole
			 source of data

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
as the primary
			 source, or at least one of the primary sources, for historical global
			 temperatures if such person or entity elects to consider multiple sources of
			 such data.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:3/ss:a

text.#text:
In publishing any findings or hypothesis
			 on global climate change, any person or entity engaged in global climate
			 research that is funded in whole or in part with funds from the Federal
			 Government shall use the dataset described in

header.#text:
Use among
			 multiple sources of data

Public release
			 of temperature station data

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for the immediate release to the public, in
			 unadjusted form, of all raw temperature station data from cooperative observers
			 and automated stations collected by the

as of the
			 date of the enactment of this Act. The data shall be released to the public in
			 a digital electronic format.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Climate Data Center

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall provide for the immediate
			 release to the public of an analysis of the differences between the raw
			 temperature datasets and the final temperature datasets collected and
			 administered by the

as of the date of the
			 enactment of this Act. The analysis shall be released to the public in digital
			 numerical tabular form and in graphical form. One such graph shall show the raw
			 temperature dataset line overlain with the final temperature dataset line over
			 time.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Climate Data Center

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Accuracy of data
			 processing and data adjustment

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as the case may be,
			 together with a notice of the availability of the review and correction of such
			 coding or algorithm for quality, objectivity, utility, and integrity by such
			 agency pursuant to the administrative mechanisms applicable to such agency
			 under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:4

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 515(b)(2)(B) of the Information Quality Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Information Quality Act/s:515/ss:b/p:2/sp:B

text.#text:
The applicable Federal official shall publish on the
			 Internet website of the agency concerned that is available to the public any
			 coding or other algorithm used by such official in processing data for purposes
			 of complying with the requirements of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be processed in accordance with the guidelines of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:5/ss:a/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
applicable to the agency concerned not later than 30 days after receipt of
			 such request by such agency.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Information Quality Act

text.#text:
Any
			 request for the correction of coding or other algorithm under

header.#text:
Methods to
			 comply with Information Quality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as the case may be, unless
			 such official ensures and certifies that such method complies with the
			 guidelines of the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:4

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, including, but not limited to,
			 requirements as follows:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Information Quality Act

text.#text:
The applicable Federal
			 official may not use a method for the adjustment of data for purposes of
			 complying with the requirements of

To make available
			 to the public (including through the Internet website of the agency concerned
			 that is available to the public) the computer coding and a detailed explanation
			 of the processes used in such adjustment of data.

To make available
			 to the public (including through such Internet website) all peer review
			 comments relating to the data being adjusted and the processes and algorithms
			 used in such adjustment of data.

To make available
			 to the public (including through such Internet website) a description of any
			 previous changes in the data being adjusted and of the effect of such changes
			 on trends, averages, and other statistical categories of such data.

To cite all
			 applicable studies, reports, and peer reviewed papers using the data being
			 adjusted or any earlier iterations of such data.

To use in such
			 adjustment of data only data and adjustment processes and algorithms that are
			 non-proprietary in nature.

To require that
			 any agents and contractors relied upon in such adjustment of data are subject
			 to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, regarding their activities in such
			 adjustment of data.
(commonly referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 552 of title 5, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Freedom of Information Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, together with a description of such method sufficient to permit
			 independent replication of the adjustment made by such method.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Public Access to Historical Records Act/s:5/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
Not later than 10 days after the date of receipt of
			 a request therefor, the applicable Federal official shall make available the
			 certification with respect to a method for the adjustment of data under

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide for the establishment, on-going validation,
		  and use of an official set of data on the historical temperature record, and
		  for other purposes.
